thread.title: 5 Best Secured Cards that Pay Interest on Your Deposit

author: Christina Majaski
title: 5 Best Secured Cards that Pay Interest on Your Deposit
text:
0% Balance Transfer Credit Cards 
Although secured credit cards provide an opportunity for those with less than stellar credit to carry a credit card while repairing credit, it doesn’t come without a price. Not only are secured credit cards notorious for high fees and high APRs, they require a security deposit that is held while the account is open in case you default on the balance or don’t make your payments. 
Most of the time, this security deposit is held and returned when you close the account less any fees or outstanding balances. There are secured cards, however, which hold the deposit in savings accounts or CDs, allowing you to earn a little bit extra while the deposit is held. While the interest you earn isn’t enough to make you rich, it can add up especially if you deposit a large amount, which also results in a higher credit limit on your card. Here are the 5 best secured credit cards which pay interest on your deposit. (See also: Best Secured Cards that Rebuild Credit ) USAA Secured Card® Platinum MasterCard® 
Your security deposit with the USAA Secured Card® Platinum MasterCard® is held in a two-year CD which currently earns a variable rate of 0.54% annual percentage yield. You can deposit at least $250 up to a maximum of $5,000. The USAA secured cards are known for being the top rated secured cards for service members, providing a number of benefits to those in the military. It also has a low foreign transaction fee of 1%, ideal for travelers, and an APR starting at just 9.90%. The annual fee is $35. Learn more and apply for the USAA Secured Card® Platinum MasterCard®. primor® Secured Visa Classic 
primor offers two secured credit cards, the Visa Classic and Visa Gold . Both cards require a security deposit of at least $200, which is held in a savings account that earns interest while it is held. While both cards allow you to earn interest on the security deposit, the difference between the gold and classic is based on whether you prefer a higher APR and lower annual fee, or higher annual fee and lower APR. This is important to consider if you consistently carry balances from week to week rather than pay them in full each month. Learn more and apply for the primor® Secured Visa Classic card . U.S. Bank Secured Visa 
When you make your security deposit for the U.S. Bank Secured Visa Card , it is used to open a savings account with U.S. Bank. The deposit is held in the account while the secured card is open and earns interest. When you close the card account, you can receive a refund of the security deposit plus the interest earned, or you can keep the savings account open. 
The U.S. Bank Secured Visa card requires a deposit of at least $300 and can be increased with additional deposits up to a total of $5,000. Another benefit to the deposit being held in a savings account is that after 12 months, your account is evaluated and you could qualify for an unsecured credit card, which would not require the deposit held in the savings account. The annual fee is $29. First National Bank Secured 
Although not as popular as some of the other secured credit cards on the market, the First National Bank Secured Credit Card is great for building or rebuilding credit. It also allows you to earn interest on your deposit of at least $300, which is held in an account that earns interest until you close the account. You can increase the deposit in increments of $50 up to a maximum of $5,000, but you cannot withdraw from the account until it’s closed. The annual fee is $19, which is at the lower end when compared to other secured credit cards. You also receive free access to your FICO score, and after 15 months, could qualify for an unsecured credit card with First National Bank. SDFCU Savings Secured Visa Platinum 
The secured credit card provided by the State Department Federal Credit Union also allows you to earn interest on your security deposit while it is held in a savings account for the duration of the account. The SDFCU Savings Secured Visa Platinum does not require any credit checks or income verification, but you do need to be a member of the credit union in order to qualify. 
The SDFCU Savings Secured Visa Platinum is among the cards with the fewest fees – no annual fee, balance transfer fee, or foreign transaction fee, plus you could qualify for an APR as low as 6.99%. Another noteworthy feature of the card is the rewards program which awards a point for every dollar spent with the card.
